page.title: 04HOME FARM - SHEEP
page.content: The ewe flock comprises 830 Greyface ewes (Swaledale - Blueface Leicester cross). The enterprise is the production of mule lambs (Greyface - Suffolk cross) to be fattened on the farm. About 1400 lambs are reared and sold between June and December. From early January the ewes are housed at Whitrigg in a specially adapted building until they lamb in March. Once the lambs are properly suckling, both are turned out to fresh grass. 200 acres of grassland is devoted to this enterprise, part of which is parkland and part leys.
